comments:
I'm using eclipse-SDK-3.0RC1-win32.
Eclipse crash by using copy/paste Ctrl+X, Ctrl+V,Ctrl+C.

*** Bug 67313 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 63564 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have released a change to Clipboard that will be included in tonight's 8PM 
build.  Could you please give this a try and see if it solves your Clipboard 
problem?

Veronika, bug 59459 against platform-text has a very similar end of the
stacktrace, but reading your comments, you did not think that it was the same
underlying problem. 

Is there a chance that the change you mention in comment 3 also fixes bug 59459?
*** Bug 67580 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Tom, What action triggers ProjectionViewer.copyToClipboard?  I will verify 
whether the fix for bug 65975 fixes this too.  But I need to know how to 
exercise this code.

Simply copy some text from the Java editor. We have added some guard code
catching DND.ERROR_CANNOT_SET_CLIPBOARD errors everywhere we put data onto the
clipboard since this can apparently fail any time if the OS' clipboard is locked
or similar.
*** Bug 67846 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I was getting this problem on RC2 (bug #67846).  Now, in RC3, I'm not getting
any more stack traces or dialogs asking me to close the workbench...  BUT, I am
(very frequently) having problems where CTRL-X, or CTRL-C doesn't "actually" put
anything in the clipboard...  So, now, with RC3, it just silently fails to
actually put things in the clipboard, so when you do "CTRL-X" to cut something,
the text disappears, and then when you do "CTRL-V" to paste it, there's nothing
there.  The "only" way I can seem to work around this, is to keep up a nice
little windows notepad, and have some text highlighted there.  If I switch to
notepad and do "ctrl-c" this seems to clear out something, and then I can go
back to eclipse and copy/paste again (for a while)..  So, It seems that cut/copy
is still really broken, and it's silent about it now...  I checked my log
several times, there's nothing there.

It's pretty bad though, I've had this problem many times today, as I've been
using RC3.

I get the same error, but it seems to be as a direct result of having a
vncviewer window also open on my desktop: to reproduce, open eclipse, open java
editor, try Ctl-C ing something, then ctl-V - works OK, open a vncviewer (3.3.6
and 4.0 exhibit the same behaviour), try ctl-C - the error occurs.
I have been told that vncviewer does not pass on clipboard message correctly,
sorry I can't elaborate further.
I /was/ getting this error regardless of vncviewer in earlier eclipse versions,
this seemed to be cured by deleting my workspace and creating a new one.
Hope any of this helps.
Bob

I just got some stack traces...  Doing same stuff, "Ctrl-X" I think this time.  
This is RC3 on Windows XP SP1.  The last stack trace repeats over and over in 
my log (about 10 times)

Comment 11 seems like a different bug.  Opened bug 68748 to track this.
Im using now eclipse 3.0 and it's ok.
seems to be back in 3.0, see bug 70077
bug 70077 is fixed in 3.0.1 M20040901 - re-closing this bug report.
